meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a craton.
meanings.sent1: The cratonic rocks are very old and stable.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the cratonic region for signs of ancient activity.
meanings.sent3: The cratonic landscape seemed to whisper tales of the past.
meanings.sent4: Her cratonic wisdom was as unyielding as the ancient mountains.
meanings.sent5: The cratonic terrain stood as a testament to time's endurance.

meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to a craton.
meanings.sent1: The cratonic core of the continent remained unchanged for eons.
meanings.sent2: Scientists analyzed the cratonic structure to understand its history.
meanings.sent3: The cratonic essence of the land was palpable in the air.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were as solid and unchanging as the cratonic foundation.
meanings.sent5: The cratonic roots ran deep, anchoring the land in stability.

meanings.sent1: The cratonic minerals were found deep beneath the surface.
meanings.sent2: Explorers ventured into the cratonic depths in search of treasures.
meanings.sent3: The cratonic caverns held secrets waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts delved into the cratonic depths of the subconscious.
meanings.sent5: The cratonic heart of the land beat steadily beneath the crust.
